fixes.name: Previous year
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR selDate = SELECTEDVALUE('Select date'[Display As])
VAR upperBound = DATE(YEAR(selDate) - 1, MONTH(selDate), DAY(selDate))
RETURN
CALCULATE(
    SUM('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales]),
    FILTER(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)',
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Date] <= upperBound
        &&
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Date] >=
            IF(
                MONTH(selDate) <= 3,
                DATE(YEAR(selDate) - 2, 4, 1),
                IF(
                    MONTH(selDate) >= 4 && YEAR(selDate) - 1 = YEAR('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Date]),
                    DATE(YEAR(selDate) - 1, 4, 1),
                    BLANK()
                )
            )
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Recreated the Tableau IF/DATEADD/MAKEDATE logic using DAX. Replaced the Tableau parameter reference with SELECTEDVALUE('Select date'[Display As]) and computed the upper bound as DATE(YEAR(selDate)-1, MONTH(selDate), DAY(selDate)). Used CALCULATE with FILTER over the Orders+ (Sample - Superstore) table to sum Sales for rows matching the original date-range conditions.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The original formula references a Tableau parameter ([Parameters].[Select date]). Per rules, any calculation that references a parameter must be implemented as a measure.
